entry.def: Felt is the past tense and past participle of feel .
Felt is a thick cloth made from wool or other fibres packed tightly together.

means.word_mean: 1. a fabric made of compressed matted animal fibers
3. change texture so as to become matted and felt-like;

sentences.sentence: "The fabric felted up after several washes"

Sentence.sentence: In 1970, a national survey showed that 37 percent of the people questioned felt their privacy was being invaded.
But having made a successful purchase from, say, Amazon, they felt safe buying elsewhere.
Without Mr Jobs to shower his star dust on the event, it felt like just another product launch from just another technology firm.
But, many of those who had poor relationships felt guilty.
Only four out of the 54 people interviewed had completely broken with their sisters and brothers and only one of the four felt comfortable with the break

More than paradise lost, a perishing rain forest could trigger a domino effect - sending winds and rains kilometers off course and loading the skies with even greater levels of greenhouse gases - that will be felt far beyond the Amazon basin.
